medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The swelling began slowly and worsened over 3 years. There was significant facial asymmetry with pain on mastication, limitation of maximal incisor opening, but no localized mass. Symptoms initially improved with indomethacin but recurred when the medication was stopped.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Ulcerative colitis confirmed two years after initial diagnosis. The patient was also HLA-B27 positive.
medical_history.family_history: Significant for autoimmune disorders. An older sister has childhood-onset HLA-B27 positive spondyloarthropathy with associated uveitis, a half-brother has psoriasis, and a maternal grandmother has rheumatoid arthritis.
